title: Blended Mobile Microlearning Program for K-12 Nursing Students: Scientific Inquiry-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational nursing theory and clinical practice experience, basic understanding of scientific methodologies (observation, hypothesis formulation, experimental design, data analysis, variable control)
context.additional_context: In a blended asynchronous/synchronous learning environment utilizing mobile devices and LMS, emphasizes data-driven patient assessment (physiological indicator measurement, symptom pattern analysis) and evidence-based nursing practice (clinical guideline application, research result interpretation).

learning_goals: In a blended learning environment applying the scientific inquiry method (hypothesis–design–analysis–conclusion), learners perform eight core nursing competencies (e.g., medication management variable analysis, patient symptom evaluation, emergency response protocols) with ≥80% accuracy

Learners engage in self-directed learning ≥2 times per week via mobile microlearning modules and record observations and evidence-based analyses (measured data, variable control methods, conclusion processes) in learning journals

Over six months, learners participate in biweekly online discussions and monthly virtual simulations, achieving ≥4 average points (5-point scale) on a 5-level rubric (analysis, inference, application, evaluation, creation) based on peer evaluations (3 reviewers) and self-evaluation (1 session), thereby demonstrating critical thinking and clinical judgment skills
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
